field.label: Enable Transport Node
field.help:
Enable transport mode to route traffic for other peers on the network.

Best Practices for Transport Nodes:
  • Stationary: Transport nodes must remain in fixed locations for reliable routing.
  • Always-on: Keep transport nodes running continuously for network stability.
  • Well-connected: Place transport nodes where they can reach multiple network segments.
  • Strategic placement: Only enable transport on nodes that provide connectivity between segments â€” not on every node.
  • Announce rates: Configure per-interface announce rate limits in the Interfaces tab to control bandwidth usage.
Transport nodes maintain path tables, forward packets across hops, and propagate announcements throughout the network. They act as distributed cryptographic keystores by caching public keys from announcements.
